newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Ciputra to build 200 bln rph housing.
newsitem.headline: Ciputra to build 200 bln rph housing.

text.p: Indonesian property developer PT Ciputra Development said on Monday it planned to start on a 200 billion rupiah housing project in Sidoarjo, East Java, later this year.

"We plan to develop the project over five years at a cost of around 200 billion rupiah," director Harun Hajadi told reporters after briefing analysts at a meeting organised by PT ING Baring Securities Indonesia.
Hajadi said the company planned to build between 12,000 and 15,000 housing units for the lower to middle income brackets in a area covering around 500 hectares in Sidoarjo.

Hajadi said Sidoarjo offered lucrative opportunities for housing developers as it had a fast expanding population with a growing number of new industrial estate projects and was located near the country's second largest city of Surabaya. ($=2,370)
